column3: Main GUPRI (i.e. PID) under which all terms are defined. Preference is to use PURLs or W3IDs as they provide permanent resolvable identifiers if they are properly configured and managed.

column1: Prefixes for controlled vocabularies, schema and ontologies

column4: Prefix for our controlled vocabulary since it is rather tedious to write long URLs all the time
Prefix for SKOS Onotlogy is which our base for defining SKOS based controlled vocabulary
Prefix for Provenance, Authoring and Versioning Onotlogy which properties such as version and createdOn we will use to describe our controlled vocabulary
Prefix for Dublin Core (Terms) Ontology which properties such as title, description, rights, source, etc. we will use to describe our controlled vocabulary as well to define its terms
Prefix for "Quantity, Unit, Dimension and Type" schema that is used to model physical units.
Prefix for QUDT Vocabulary of Units which terms we will use to semantically define units of measurements for terms (i.e., variables) we are defining

column2: Quantitative and qualitative and quantitative variables describing ...

column3: An ORCID ID of the vocabulary creator
License under which the vocabulary is provided
Date when vocabulary was initially created
Date of the last vocabulary update

column5: This is a parent concept containing controlled terms representing atmospheric variables.
This is a parent concept containing controlled terms representing water variables.
This is an overarching concept containing variables that are not field specific.

Speed is the magnitude of velocity. Wind is defined as a two-dimensional (horizontal) air velocity vector, with no vertical component. (Vertical motion in the atmosphere has the standard name upward_air_velocity.) The wind speed is the magnitude of the wind velocity.

Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

Longitude is positive eastward; its units of degree_east (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_longitude should be used instead of longitude. Grid longitude is positive in the grid-eastward direction, but its units should be plain degree.
Air pressure is the force per unit area which would be exerted when the moving gas molecules of which the air is composed strike a theoretical surface of any orientation.
